nodes.bodyText: Don't you need to release the char array after use with (*env)->ReleaseCharArrayElements(env, jchars, chars, 0)?

+JNIEXPORT void JNICALL Java_com_gluonhq_helloandroid_MainActivity_nativeDispatchLifecycleEvent(JNIEnv *env, jobject activity, jcharArray jchars, jint count)
+{
+    LOGE(stderr, "Dispatching lifecycle event from native Dalvik layer");
+    jchar *chars = (*env)->GetCharArrayElements(env, jchars, 0);
+    attach_setLifecycleEvent(chars, count);

nodes.bodyText: These files were introduced in 2020, so no need to add 2019?
Would length be a more suitable name for the variable named count?

nodes.bodyText: I was wondering if passing an int instead of a string might be easier? The int values can be easily mapped to the matching LifecycleEvent enum in Attach?

commit.message: Use char array instead of String

nodes.bodyText:
this should be
Java_com_gluonhq_helloandroid_MainActivity_nativeDispatchLifecycleEvent(JNIEnv *env, jobject activity, jstring event)

commit.message: Use string instead of char array

nodes.bodyText:
Don't pass java types in between native layers.
This better done as
void __attribute__((weak)) attach_setLifecycleEvent(const char *chars)

commit.message: Use jstring and const char. Fix headers
